faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Common questions about the Job Worth Calculator

items.question: How accurate is Job Worth Calculator?
items.answer: Job Worth Calculator is based on a scientific salary evaluation model that considers multiple dimensions including salary, work hours, and environmental factors. While not 100% precise, it provides objective reference data for your job evaluation.

items.question: What is PPP purchasing power parity?
items.answer: PPP is a purchasing power parity index used to compare the actual purchasing power of currencies in different countries. Job Worth Calculator uses PPP data to make salaries from different countries comparable.

items.question: Will my data be saved?
items.answer: All calculations are performed locally in your browser, and data is not uploaded to servers. History records are only saved in your browser, ensuring privacy and security.

items.question: How to understand the job value score?
items.answer: Higher scores indicate better job value. Generally: below 0.6 is terrible, 0.6-1.0 is poor, 1.0-1.8 is average, 1.8-2.5 is good, 2.5-3.2 is great, 3.2-4.0 is excellent, and above 4.0 is perfect.

items.question: Which countries and regions are supported?
items.answer: Currently supports PPP data for 190+ countries and regions worldwide, covering major developed and developing countries. Data sources include authoritative institutions like the World Bank.

items.question: Can calculation results be shared?
items.answer: Yes! You can generate sharing links or save as images to share your job value analysis results with friends and colleagues.
